title.narrative: ED1-ACCESS TO INCLUSIVE QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, preschool and elementary school children and adolescents excluded from the education system have access to an inclusive quality education service, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children of pre-primary and primary age (girls and boys), and especially those living in the most disadvantaged areas, complete the relevant cycle for their age.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, preschool and elementary school children and adolescents excluded from the education system have access to an inclusivequality education service

description.narrative: En 2021, malgré la crise sanitaire et sécuritaire, l’UNICEF a mobilisé les acteurs du secteur pour assurer la continuité des activités éducatives et améliorer l’accès des enfants et des adolescents à des apprentissages de qualité et équitables, grâce à un plaidoyer de haut niveau, une plus grande mobilisation communautaire, la mise à l’échelle de l’initiative innovante d’enseignement par les radios communautaires et le soutien à l’éducation inclusive à travers des cash-transferts. Avec l’appui de l’UNICEF, 172 salles de classes primaires ont été construites ou réhabilitées, et 137 114 élèves ont reçu des kits pédagogiques dans les huit Inspections académiques. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/01/2022
